meta.author: Śrīla Bhakti Sundar Govinda Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj

title: Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa Māhātmya
subtitle: The Glories of Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa
Śrī Girirāj-khaṇḍam – Śrī Garga-saṁhitā

text: atha govardhane ramye surabhi gauḥ samudrajā
snāpayā māsa gopeśaṁ dugdha dhārābhi rātnanaḥ
surabhe dugdha dhārābhi govinda snānato nṛpa
kadā chittasmin dugdhasya svādutvaṁ prati padyate
tatra snātvā naraḥ sākṣād govinda padamāpnuyāt
govinda kuṇḍe viśade yaḥ snāti kṛṣṇa-mānasaḥ

subtitle: Bengali verse illumination
by Śrīla Bhakti Sundar Govinda Dev-Goswāmī Mahārāj

translation: Surabhī, the divine cow who appeared from churning the milk ocean, lovingly bathed Vrajendra Nandan Krishna with her own milk.

text: sei dugdhe pūrṇa kuṇḍa ‘śrī govinda’ nāma
translation: The pond filled with that milk, “Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa,” graces beautiful Govardhan with exquisite beauty.

The transcendental water of this Kuṇḍa can banish even the greatest sins. The threefold miseries—*ādhyātmic*, *ādhidaivic* and *ādhibhautic*—and all fears of this material world are destroyed by bathing in or drinking this water.
Sometimes, by great fortune, someone will get to taste the water of Govinda Kuṇḍa as that milk, attain a transcendental form, and go to Krishna-*loka*.

text: śrī kṛṣṇa-mānase jebā kore hethā snāna
translation: Anyone who bathes in Śrī Govinda Kuṇḍa, desiring to serve Krishna, attains divine service of Śrī Śrī Rādhā-Krishna in Gupta Govardhan (hidden Govardhan).
